name: memory-bank-copilot
description: Native GitHub Copilot integration with persistent memory and context using Language Model Tools API

languageModelTools.name: memory_bank_update_context
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Updates the active context file with the current working focus. Use this when the user wants to set their current task, goal, or area of focus. This helps maintain continuity across coding sessions.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Set your current working focus in the memory bank

context.description: The current context or focus area to set

languageModelTools.name: memory_bank_log_decision
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Logs an important architectural or implementation decision to the decision log. Use this when the user makes or mentions a significant choice about technology, architecture, or implementation approach.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Log an important decision to the memory bank

languageModelTools.name: memory_bank_update_progress
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Updates the progress tracking with done, doing, and next items. Use this when the user mentions completing tasks, starting new work, or planning upcoming activities.

languageModelTools.name: memory_bank_show_memory
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Displays the content of a specific memory bank file. Use this when the user wants to see what's currently stored in their project memory files.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Show content from a memory bank file

fileName.description: The memory bank file to display

languageModelTools.name: memory_bank_update_all
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Analyzes the current workspace and updates relevant memory bank files based on recent changes, new files, and project state. Use this when the user wants to sync their memory bank with current project state.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Update memory bank based on current workspace

languageModelTools.name: memory_bank_switch_mode
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Switches the memory bank working mode between Architect (design), Code (implementation), Ask (questions), and Debug (troubleshooting). Different modes provide access to different memory files.

mode.description: The working mode to switch to

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
